title: Alphabetical Reversal Checker (Easy)
description:
Given a string, check if it reads the same forwards and backwards when only considering the alphabetic characters (ignoring case).This function signature is required.#### Function Signature```pythonndef is_alphabetical_reversal(s: str) -> bool:```

Input
- `s` (str): A string that may contain letters, spaces, punctuation, and numbers.
Output
- Returns `True` if the input string reads the same forwards and backwards when only considering alphabetic characters, `False` otherwise.
code:
def is_alphabetical_reversal(s: str) -> bool:
    # Remove non-alphabetic characters
    s = ''.join(char for char in s if char.isalpha())
    # Check if the remaining string reads the same forwards and backwards
    return s == s[::-1]
tests: assert is_alphabetical_reversal('A man, a plan, a canal, Panama') == False
assert is_alphabetical_reversal('Listen, an airplane flew over head') == False
